creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: female figure at R in tattered dress carrying a baby in a bundle; cup or pan hanging from her belt at L; shorter figure also in rags standing and facing the woman, leaning on cane; stone building in background
inscription:
Inscription 

-- numbered in plate at lower left: 7 
-- publisher inscribed at lower right: Israel ex.
-- in graphite on verso, center of sheet: Dev 110 11/11
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: A Poor Woman Standing, Holding an Infant, From Caprices, Plate 7
